metadata.subject: Constrained From Fighting, Trump Is Left a Spectator With Kavanaugh in Peril

relationships.description: President Trump nominated Kavanaugh to the Supreme Court
Trump is frustrated with Republican senators' handling of Kavanaugh confirmation
Ford has accused Kavanaugh of sexual assault from decades ago

analysis.purpose: To analyze President Trump's constrained position in the Kavanaugh confirmation battle and the political dynamics surrounding sexual assault allegations
analysis.significance: Documents a critical moment in Supreme Court confirmation history during the #MeToo era, showing presidential frustration and political calculations

notable_quotes: "I've been in politics for two and a half years, and I'm the president of the United States." - Donald Trump
"I would advise the president to let us handle this." - Lindsey Graham
"How the Senate handles this and the Senate Republicans handle this will be a test of this time, of 2018, in the #MeToo movement." - Patty Murray
red_flags: Political pressure on sexual assault allegations
Potential electoral consequences influencing judicial confirmation

blackmail_indicators.description: No evidence of blackmail or coercion found in this news analysis article

illegal_activity.description: This is a news article reporting on political events and allegations, not first-hand evidence of illegal activity

details: Media coverage of sexual assault allegations

public_knowledge.context: This New York Times article was published publicly about the high-profile Kavanaugh confirmation battle and sexual assault allegations, which received extensive media coverage

analysis.summary: This New York Times news analysis article examines President Trump's frustration with his limited ability to influence the Brett Kavanaugh Supreme Court confirmation process amid sexual assault allegations, highlighting the political tensions between Trump's aggressive instincts and Republican senators' cautious approach during the #MeToo era.
